member.summary: Contains the Items in the ExplorerBrowser. The collection is gathered upon first retreival. It is updated internally when the items change, i.e. by moving to another folder. The items returned may be sorted differently than the view.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ExplorerBrowser.SelectedItems

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.IExplorerBrowser.Initialize(System.IntPtr,Jam.Shell.RECT@,Jam.Shell.Com.FolderSettings@)
member.summary: Prepares the browser to be navigated.
member.param: A handle to the owner window or control.

A pointer to a RECT containing the coordinates of the bounding rectangle the browser will occupy. The coordinates are relative to hwndParent. If this parameter is NULL, then method IExplorerBrowser::SetRect should subsequently be called.

A pointer to a FOLDERSETTINGS structure that determines how the folder will be displayed in the view. If this parameter is NULL, then method IExplorerBrowser::SetFolderSettings should be called, otherwise, the default view settings for the folder are used.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.JamBaseShellListView.DefineColumnSortOrder
member.summary: The sortorder of columns is defined by an array containing internal column indices. [0, 2, 1] will switch the last columns in the display. The internal order of columns is not changed. This is a basic implementation sorting custom columns to the end of the list. Derived classes may overwrite the Default Sortorder.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.JamBaseShellListView.SetColumnVisibility(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the visibility of a column.
member.param: The shell column index. Note: Deleting column 0 is not allowed.
True to show the column, false to hide.
member.returns: 0 or more: the index of the added column. -1: the column was successfully removed. -2: the 'name' column should be removed but thats not allowed. -3: the column index was not supported by the current folder.
member.remarks: If you don't know the shell column index, you may find it using the function . Just loop over the possible 255 columns and compare the returned column title with your wanted column title. Note that the column title depends on your system language.

members.member:
Sets the visibility of a column.
The . Note: Deleting the name column is not allowed. True to show the column, false to hide.
0 or more: the index of the added column. -1: the column was successfully removed. -2: the 'name' column should be removed but thats not allowed. -3: the column is not available for the current folder.
/// If you don't know the SHCOLUMNID, you may find it using the function and . Just loop over the possible 255 columns and compare the returned column title with your wanted column title. As soon as you found the correct shell column number, use the to convert it into a . Note that the column title depends on your system language.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.JamBaseShellListView.ShellContextMenu
member.summary: Indicates whether the Windows ShellContextMenu should be shown or not.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.JamBaseShellListView.ShowShellContextMenuOnTop
member.summary: If set to to 'true', the shell context menu will be shown on top of the provided popup menu. If set to 'false', the shell context menu will be shown below the provided popup menu. The value true is currently not supported. The menu items will be shown correctly, however their Click event cannot be triggered.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.JamBaseShellListView.ContextMenuStrip
member.summary: The ContextMenuStrip is converted to an ordinary ContextMenu. This makes it possible to merge your ContextMenuStrip with the Default ShellContextMenu provided by the system. The "Opening" and "Closing" events of the ContextMenuStrip will be raised if the ContextMenu "Popup"/"Collapse" event occurs. For menu items only the "Click" event is available. All other events are not available. All ToolStripMenuItems are converted, and ToolStripSeparators are recognized. The ShortCut Keys defined in a ToolStripMenuItem are not converted. If you would like to have the ShortCut-Keys, leave this Property null, instead set the ContextMenu property to your menu explicitly.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.JamBaseShellListView.SelectedFiles
member.summary: This property provides access to a list of all files including their extension, which are currently selected in the ShellListView. Dependent on the user settings, the file names in the ListView may be displayed without extension, which makes it difficult to further process them when they are accessed only by the property. You can also use the SelectedFiles property to add files to the selection by using SelectedFiles.Add method.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.PathEdit
member.summary: The PathEdit is a simple component that allows the user to enter a path or to browse for it. The user can open a browse dialog by pressing the button on the right. Use the Path property to set a default path or the get the path that the user has finally chosen. Use The FolderMode property to define if the user should enter / browse for a path to a file or a folder.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.ShellFilePreview
member.summary: Use this component to display a preview of a file. Depending on the installed PreviewHandlers not all files types support a preview. If no preview is registered, a thumbnail of the file is shown. You may either use the property to set a path to a file to load the preview or you may synchronize it to a or component using the property.
member.remarks: The component is using the Preview Handlers registered in the system to display the files, so that normally the same files that Windows Explorer can preview should be supported. There are occasional problems concerning the bitness of the application using the ShellFilePreview vs. the bitness of the PreviewHandler registered for a filetype. With the event it is also possible to use existing PreviewHandlers to display other file extensions. If you want to preview Microsoft Outlook .msg files and only the header is displayed, make sure to have Visual Styles enabled for your application. Call "Application.EnableVisualStyles()" or change your application manifest accordingly.

member.remarks: As compared to the property there are files that do not have a physical path but still have an ItemIdList (like files on attached devices). If the ShellFilePreview shall be synchronized with other ShellBrowser components this is most easily done using the property. However currently synchronization to a is not supported. In this case you can use this property to do a manual synchronization.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.PathSelectionList.GetFileEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an Enumerator to use the PathSelectionList in a foreach statement.
member.remarks:
The Enumerator will only return files in the list, not directories or drives. If the contains a Drive or a large directory using GetFileEnumerator might be slow, because all Files contained in the Directories are iterated. As compared to GetFileEnumerator iterating the directly will return a unified list consisting of folders and files.
If folder "c:\Windows" is added to a GetFileEnumerator will return all files in Windows and its subdirectories. Iterating it directly will returns "c:\Windows\*". To use this in e.g. a you must trim the "*".
member.returns: Returns all files for the selected paths.

ShellAutoComplete.Url needs to be used to also provide autocompletion for UNC-Paths.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellComboBox.DropDownStyle
member.summary: If DropDownStyle is DropDown, the shell autocompletion mode is enabled. If it is DropDownList, the shell autocompletion is disabled, ie. no edit field is provided. The default value is . ComboBoxStyle.Simple is not supported and ignored.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellComboBox.SelectedPath
member.summary: Use this property to get or set the currently selected path the ShellCombo is displaying. The path may be empty if the user selected an object that does not belong to the filesystem (i.e. Network). If you'd like to also handle these virtual file items, consider using the property instead.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.ShellControlConnector
member.summary: This component is able to synchronize several of the visual shell components , and . Just drop a ShellControlConnector component to this form and assign the ShellControlConnector property of all shell components to the ShellControlConnector component. You can refresh all connected shell controls by using the FullRefresh() method. If you want to use CheckBoxes in a or , that must be connected to a ShellControlConnector. The ShellControlConnector will synchronize the selected files and folder in the different shell controls.

An optional ItemIdList that identifies the file or folder that should be refreshed. This value can be null.

member.summary: This dictionary contains LIST_ITEM entries sorted by filename, for fast access

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.CustomFileList`1.BackgroundWorker
member.summary: Returns the Backgroundworker that is associated with each FileList instance. The BackgroundWorker is the required and preferred way to asynchronously add items to a component from a different thread. See http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms171728.aspx.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.CustomFileList`1.UseThreadPool
member.summary: Whether to use the system threadpool to obtain information on listview items. If this property is false (the default value), the complete file detail information is retrieved as soon as the item is displayed the first time within the listview. Sometimes it is useful to have all file information fetched as soon as possible without loosing userinterface responsiveness. If set to true, the item information for all files in the listview is additionally fetched from the background this further enhances performance on multicore systems.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.CustomFileList`1.AllowDropToTheBackground
member.summary: If this property is set to true, the user is allowed to drop items onto the background in order to add them to the displayed list of files.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.CustomFileList`1.CopyMode
member.summary: Copy mode allows you to control the behaviour when files or folders get dropped.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.CustomFileList`1.AutoScrollDelay
member.summary: The delay in milliseconds after that the control scrolls automatically during a drag and drop operation. A value of 0 disables the auto scroll feature.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.CustomFileList`1.OwnerDraw
member.summary: The value of the OwnerDraw property must always be true. This is why the Property is reimplemented here. The setting to false is ignored, and a debug message is shown.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.CustomFileList`1.CheckBoxes
member.summary: Use this property to turn on or off the checkboxes for file and folder selection. The checkboxes will only work, if a has been assigned to the ShellControlConnector property of this component. It will automatically synchronize the selection state of the items in multiple shell controls linked together with this ShellControlConnector.

member.summary: This property is always false for FileList and DriveList.

member.summary: Construct a FileSearcher object. Registers itself to the DoWork event of the BackgroundWorker passed and keeps a reference to asynchronously cancel the search. The FileSearcher object will not try to estimate the percentage, use if you want to estimate the percentage.

An object implementing the IFileMatcher interface that is can be used to extend/tune the search criterion

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.FileSearcher.#ctor(Jam.Shell.SearchOptions,System.String[],System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker,Jam.Shell.IFileMatcher,System.Byte)
member.summary: Construct a FileSearcher object. Registers itself to the DoWork event of the BackgroundWorker passed and keeps a reference to asynchronously cancel the search. The FileSearcher object will roughly estimate the percentage until the search finishes if the recursive flag is set in the SearchOptions
member.param: The BackgroundWorker object.
An object implementing the IFileMatcher interface that is can be used to extend/tune the search criterion

The depth the directory searchpath is scanned for subfolders (values 2 or 3 are good), to give an estimation of the time needed to finish the search. If this parameter is 0 no estimation is performed.

member.summary: Searches the paths given in the parameter for patterns defined in the property.
member.remarks:
The search itself is done in a background worker thread. With event you can further customize the search result. Information on Progress is passed via event .
Exceptions that occur during the search are by default suppressed, but you can influence this with event .
member.param: Array of paths in which to search for the pattern.
if true, the searcher tries to estimate percentage of search progress and sets a value in .
if set to true an exception is thrown if a path does not exist this often occurs with removable devices
member.exception: If any of the provided paths is not valid, or not existing.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.FileList.CountFolders
member.summary: True if the TotalFileSize and TotalFileCount should include folders. Warning: FileSize/FileCount are calculated in a background-thread, so the correct result may take some time if the "file" is a folder and files are located in it's subfolders (recursive calculation). In that case, the default value -1 is returned if the calculation could not finish in time. This behaviour will be fixed soon (bug #2895).

member.summary: Instantiates an open DateInterval. If 'after' is true, returns true for all all time points after the specified p_Time. If 'after' is false, returns true for all all time points that are before the p_Time specified.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.DateTimeInterval.SetInterval(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime})

Right bound of the interval.
member.exception: Throws ArgumentException if p_MinTime is after p_MaxTime

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.DateTimeInterval.IsInInterval(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Checks whether the time given as a parameter is within the interval specified by this DateInterval instance.
member.param: the datetime to check
member.returns: true, if p_DateTime is after the minimum time and p_DateTime is before the maximum time. If the minimum was not specified (has been set to null) it returns true if p_DateTime is before the maximum time set. If the maximum was not specified it returns true if p_DateTime is after the minimum time set.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.DateTimeInterval.Min
member.summary: The left bound of the DateInterval To keep the bounds consistent if Min is set to a time point after Max, the bounds are switched.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.DateTimeInterval.Max
member.summary: The right bound of the DateInterval. To keep the bounds consistent if Max is set to a time point before Min, the bounds are switched.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.ShellHistoryToolStrip

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.Com.IOleWindow
member.summary: Implemented and used by containers and objects to obtain window handles and manage context-sensitive help.
member.remarks: The IOleWindow interface provides methods that allow an application to obtain the handle to the various windows that participate in in-place activation, and also to enter and exit context-sensitive help mode.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.Com.IOleWindow.GetWindow(System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Returns the window handle to one of the windows participating in in-place activation (frame, document, parent, or in-place object window).
member.param: Pointer to where to return the window handle.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.Com.IOleWindow.ContextSensitiveHelp(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether context-sensitive help mode should be entered during an in-place activation session.
member.param: true if help mode should be entered; false if it should be exited.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellSystemList.SelectedItemIdList
member.summary: Get the selected item id list in the SystemShellView. This property returns null, if nothing is selected. The setter of this property is protected since the exact ItemIdList that is stored in the explorer ole instance is needed to select the item in the view. It is insufficient to construct a new one with new ItemIdList("fullpath"); and pass that as a value. The instantiated ole window will not select an item that way.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellSystemList.ContextMenuStrip
member.summary: The ContextMenuStrip is converted to an ordinary ContextMenu. This makes it possible to merge your ContextMenuStrip with the Default ShellContextMenu provided by the system. The "Opening" and "Closing" events of the ContextMenuStrip will be raised if the ContextMenu "Popup"/"Collapse" event occurs. For menu items only the "Click" event is available. All other events are not available. All ToolStripMenuItems are converted, and ToolStripSeparators are recognized. The ShortCut Keys defined in a ToolStripMenuItem are not converted. If you would like to have the ShortCut-Keys, leave this Property null, instead set the ContextMenu property to your menu explicitly.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellSystemList.ContextMenu

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.ShellTreeView
member.summary: A ShellTreeView displays the shell namespace in a tree. When the user right clicks on a folder, it will automatically show the context menu. Use the property to get the currently selected path, use the property to check if a special folder like the Control Panel is currently selected. Usually a ShellTreeView component will be rooted the desktop folder, but you can use the property to choose a different root folder. You can synchronize a with a ShellTreeView by using the property.

member.summary: Use the SmartRefresh to update the contents of a . In comparison to the method, SmartRefresh is much faster, but only removes objects which have been deleted and adds objects which have been added. It doesn't update changed file sizes or dates. Usually this method will be called automatically, when a file was added or deleted.

The checkboxes will only work, if a instance has been assigned to the ShellControlConnector property of this component. It will automatically synchronize the selection state of the items in multiple shell controls linked together with this ShellControlConnector.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellTreeView.SelectedPath
member.summary: Use SelectedPath to get or set the path, which is currently selected in the . If the currently selected path is not a file system folder, SelectedPath returns an empty string and you should use the property to get the type of this path. If you`re looking for the path an operation was performed on (e.g. Drop), use the event.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellTreeView.SpecialFolder
member.summary: SpecialFolder allows you to check, if the currently selected folder is a special folder (e.g. the Control Panel) or to make a special folder the selected folder. Use the SelectedPath property if you want to deal with file system folders.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellTreeView.AutomaticRefresh
member.summary: Enables the automatic refreshes of the control, e.g. when a file is added or deleted in the current directory.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellTreeView.AutoExpandDelay
member.summary: The delay in milliseconds after that a folder is expanded automatically during a drag and drop operation. A value of 0 disables the auto expand feature.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellTreeView.AutoScrollDelay
member.summary: The delay in milliseconds after that the control scrolls automatically during a drag and drop operation. A value of 0 disables the auto scroll feature.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellTreeView.CopyMode
member.summary: Copy mode allows you to control the behaviour when files or folders get dropped.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellTreeView.ContextMenuStrip
member.summary: The ContextMenuStrip is converted to an ordinary ContextMenu. This makes it possible to merge your ContextMenuStrip with the Default ShellContextMenu provided by the system. The "Opening" and "Closing" events of the ContextMenuStrip will be raised if the ContextMenu "Popup"/"Collapse" event occurs. For menu items only the "Click" event is available. All other events are not available. All ToolStripMenuItems are converted, and ToolStripSeparators are recognized. The ShortCut Keys defined in a ToolStripMenuItem are not converted. If you would like to have the ShortCut-Keys, leave this Property null, instead set the ContextMenu property to your menu explicitly.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder
member.summary: ShellFolder values provide a unique system-independent way to identify special folders used frequently by applications, but which may not have the same name or location on any given system.
member.remarks: Known folder constants begin with 0x0050

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.AdminTools
member.summary: The file system directory that is used to store administrative tools for an individual user. The Microsoft Management Console (MMC) will save customized consoles to this directory, and it will roam with the user.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.AltStartup
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the user's nonlocalized Startup program group.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.AppData
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for application-specific data. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Application Data. This CSIDL is supported by the redistributable Shfolder.dll for systems that do not have the Microsoft Internet Explorer 4.0 integrated Shell installed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.AppUpdates
member.summary: The virtual folder containing the installed application updates.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.BitBucket
member.summary: The virtual folder containing the objects in the user's Recycle Bin.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CDBurnArea
member.summary: The file system directory acting as a staging area for files waiting to be written to CD. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Application Data\Microsoft\CD Burning.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonAdminTools
member.summary: The file system directory containing administrative tools for all users of the computer.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonAltStartup
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the nonlocalized Startup program group for all users. Valid only for Microsoft Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonAppData
member.summary: The file system directory containing application data for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application Data.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonDesktopDirectory
member.summary: The file system directory that contains files and folders that appear on the desktop for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Desktop. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonDocuments
member.summary: The file system directory that contains documents that are common to all users. A typical paths is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents. Valid for Windows NT systems and Microsoft Windows 95 and Windows 98 systems with Shfolder.dll installed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonFavorites
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for favorite items common to all users. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonMusic
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for music files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Music.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonPictures
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for image files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Pictures.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonPrograms
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the directories for the common program groups that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonStartmenu
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the programs and folders that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonStartup
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the programs that appear in the Startup folder for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs\Startup. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonTemplates
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the templates that are available to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Templates. Valid only for Windows NT systems.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.CommonVideo
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for video files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Videos.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ComputersNearMe
member.summary: The folder representing other computers in your workgroup.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Connections
member.summary: The virtual folder representing Network Connections, containing network and dial-up connections.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Contacts
member.summary: The virtual folder containing the users contacts.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Controls
member.summary: The virtual folder containing icons for the Control Panel applications.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Cookies
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet cookies. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Cookies.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Desktop
member.summary: The virtual folder representing the Windows desktop, the root of the namespace.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.DesktopDirectory
member.summary: The file system directory used to physically store file objects on the desktop (not to be confused with the desktop folder itself). A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Desktop.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Documents
member.summary: The users documents folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.DocumentsLibrary
member.summary: The documents library.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Downloads
member.summary: The downloads folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Drives
member.summary: The virtual folder representing My Computer, containing everything on the local computer: storage devices, printers, and Control Panel. The folder may also contain mapped network drives.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Favorites
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for the user's favorite items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Favorites.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Fonts
member.summary: A virtual folder containing fonts. A typical path is C:\Windows\Fonts.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Games
member.summary: The games folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.History
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet history items.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Homegroup
member.summary: The home group, only on Windows 7 and later.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Internet
member.summary: A virtual folder for Internet Explorer (icon on desktop).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.InternetCache
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for temporary Internet files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Temporary Internet Files.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Libraries
member.summary: The libraries folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Links
member.summary: The folder %USERPROFILE%\Links.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.LocalAppData
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a data repository for local (nonroaming) applications. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Application Data.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.LocalAppDataLow
member.summary: The LocalLow folder of the users appdata - %USERPROFILE%\AppData\LocalLow.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.MusicLibrary
member.summary: The music library.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.MyMusic
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for music files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\User\My Documents\My Music.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.MyPictures
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for image files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\My Pictures.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.MyVideo
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for video files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\My Videos.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Nethood
member.summary: A file system directory containing the link objects that may exist in the My Network Places virtual folder. It is not the same as CSIDL_NETWORK, which represents the network namespace root. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\NetHood.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Network
member.summary: A virtual folder representing Network Neighborhood, the root of the network namespace hierarchy.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Personal
member.summary: The file system directory used to physically store a user's common repository of documents. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents. This should be distinguished from the virtual My Documents folder in the namespace.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.PicturesLibrary
member.summary: The pictures library.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Printers
member.summary: The virtual folder containing installed printers.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Printhood
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the link objects that can exist in the Printers virtual folder. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\PrintHood.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Profile
member.summary: The user's profile folder. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username. Applications should not create files or folders at this level; they should put their data under the locations referred to by or .

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFiles
member.summary: The Program Files folder. A typical path is C:\Program Files.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFilesCommon
member.summary: A folder for components that are shared across applications. A typical path is C:\Program Files\Common. Valid only for Windows NT, Windows 2000, and Windows XP systems. Not valid for Windows Millennium Edition (Windows Me).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFilesCommonX64
member.summary: This value is not supported on 32-bit operating systems. It also is not supported for 32-bit applications running on 64-bit operating systems. Attempting to use it in either situation results in an error.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFilesCommonX86
member.summary: A folder for components that are shared across applications. A typical path is C:\Program Files\Common. Valid only for Windows NT, Windows 2000, and Windows XP systems. Not valid for Windows Millennium Edition (Windows Me).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFilesX64
member.summary: This value is not supported on 32-bit operating systems. It also is not supported for 32-bit applications running on 64-bit operating systems. Attempting to use it in either situation results in an error.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.ProgramFilesX86
member.summary: The Program Files folder. A typical path is C:\Program Files.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Programs
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the user's program groups (which are themselves file system directories). A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu\Programs.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Public
member.summary: The %PUBLIC% folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.PublicDownloads
member.summary: The public downloads folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.PublicLibraries
member.summary: The public libraries folder.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.QuickLaunch
member.summary: The folder containing the quicklaunch links.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Recent
member.summary: The file system directory that contains shortcuts to the user's most recently used documents. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Recent Documents.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Resources
member.summary: Windows Vista. The file system directory that contains resource data. A typical path is C:\Windows\Resources.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.SavedGames
member.summary: The folder containing the savegames.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.SavedSearches
member.summary: The folder containing saved searches.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.SendTo
member.summary: The file system directory that contains Send To menu items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\SendTo.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Startmenu
member.summary: The file system directory containing Start menu items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Startup
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the user's Startup program group. The system starts these programs whenever any user logs onto Windows NT or starts Windows 95. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu\Programs\Startup.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.System
member.summary: The Windows System folder. A typical path is C:\Windows\System32.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.SystemX86
member.summary: The Windows System folder. A typical path is C:\Windows\System32.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.Templates
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for document templates. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Templates.

member.summary: The folder containing the users profiles.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.ShellFolder.UsersFiles
member.summary: The folder containing the users files.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags
member.summary: The folder flags are used to specify how the control displays its content. Most of these flags can be or'ed together. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb762508(VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.None
member.summary: 0x00000000. Windows 7 and later. No special view options.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.AutoArrange
member.summary: Automatically arrange the elements in the view. This implies LVS_AUTOARRANGE if the list view control is used to implement the view.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.AbbreviatedNames
member.summary: Abbreviate names. This flag is not currently supported.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.SnapToGrid
member.summary: Arrange items on a grid. This flag is not currently supported.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.BestFitWindow
member.summary: This flag is currently not supported.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.Desktop
member.summary: Enable the best-fit window mode. Let the view size the window so that its contents fit inside the view window in the best possible manner.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.SingleSelection
member.summary: Do not allow more than a single item to be selected. This is used in the common dialog boxes.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoSubFolders
member.summary: Do not show subfolders.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.Transparent
member.summary: Draw transparently. This is used only for the desktop.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoClientEdge
member.summary: This flag is currently not supported.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoScroll
member.summary: Do not add scroll bars. This is used only for the desktop.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.AlignLeft
member.summary: The view should be left-aligned. This implies LVS_ALIGNLEFT if the list view control is used to implement the view.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoIcons
member.summary: The view should not display icons.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.ShowSelectionAlways
member.summary: Always show the selection.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoVisible
member.summary: This flag is currently not supported.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.SingleClickActivate
member.summary: This flag is currently not supported.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoWebView
member.summary: The view should not be shown as a Web view.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.HideFilenames
member.summary: The view should not display file names.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.CheckSelect
member.summary: Turns on the check mode for the view.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoEnumRefresh
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: Do not re-enumerate the view (or drop the current contents of the view) when the view is refreshed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoGrouping
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: Do not allow grouping in the view

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.FullRowSelect
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: When an item is selected, the item and all its sub-items are highlighted.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoFilters
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: Do not display filters in the view.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoColumnHeader
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: Do not display a column header in the view in any view mode.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoHeaderInAllViews
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: Only show the column header in details view mode.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.ExtendedTiles
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: When the view is in "tile view mode" the layout of a single item should be extended to the width of the view.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.TriCheckSelect
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: Check boxes have 3 modes: unchecked, SVSI_CHECK, SVSI_CHECK2.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.AutoCheckSelect
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: Items can be selected using checkboxes.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.NoBrowserViewState
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: The view should not save view state in the browser.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.SubsetGrouops
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: The view should list the number of items displayed in each group. To be used with IFolderView2::SetGroupSubsetCount.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.FolderFlags.UseSearchFolder
member.summary: Windows Vista and later: Use the search folder for stacking and searching.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.LibraryFolderFilter
member.summary: Defines options for filtering folder items.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.LibraryFolderFilter.LFF_FORCEFILESYSTEM
member.summary: Return only file system items.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.LibraryFolderFilter.LFF_STORAGEITEMS
member.summary: Return items that can be bound to an IStorage object.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.LibraryFolderFilter.LFF_ALLITEMS
member.summary: Return all items.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_READ
member.summary: Indicates that the object is read-only, meaning that modifications cannot be made. For example, if a stream object is opened with STGM_READ, the ISequentialStream::Read method may be called, but the ISequentialStream::Write method may not. Similarly, if a storage object opened with STGM_READ, the IStorage::OpenStream and IStorage::OpenStorage methods may be called, but the IStorage::CreateStream and IStorage::CreateStorage methods may not.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_WRITE
member.summary: Enables you to save changes to the object, but does not permit access to its data. The provided implementations of the IPropertyStorage and IPropertySetStorage interfaces do not support this write-only mode.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_READWRITE
member.summary: Enables access and modification of object data. For example, if a stream object is created or opened in this mode, it is possible to call both IStream::Read and IStream::Write. Be aware that this constant is not a simple binary OR operation of the STGM_WRITE and STGM_READ elements.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_SHARE_DENY_NONE
member.summary: Specifies that subsequent openings of the object are not denied read or write access. If no flag from the sharing group is specified, this flag is assumed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_SHARE_DENY_READ
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in STGM_READ mode. It is typically used on a root storage object.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object for STGM_WRITE or STGM_READWRITE access. In transacted mode, sharing of STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE or STGM_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE can significantly improve performance because they do not require snapshots.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in any mode. Be aware that this value is not a simple bitwise OR operation of the STGM_SHARE_DENY_READ and STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE values. In transacted mode, sharing of STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE or STGM_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE can significantly improve performance because they do not require snapshots.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_PRIORITY
member.summary: Opens the storage object with exclusive access to the most recently committed version. Thus, other users cannot commit changes to the object while you have it open in priority mode. You gain performance benefits for copy operations, but you prevent others from committing changes. Limit the time that objects are open in priority mode. You must specify STGM_DIRECT and STGM_READ with priority mode, and you cannot specify STGM_DELETEONRELEASE. STGM_DELETEONRELEASE is only valid when creating a root object, such as with StgCreateStorageEx. It is not valid when opening an existing root object, such as with StgOpenStorageEx. It is also not valid when creating or opening a subelement, such as with IStorage::OpenStorage.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_CREATE
member.summary:
Indicates that an existing storage object or stream should be removed before the new object replaces it. A new object is created when this flag is specified only if the existing object has been successfully removed. This flag is used when attempting to create:
A storage object on a disk, but a file of that name exists. An object inside a storage object, but a object with the specified name exists. A byte array object, but one with the specified name exists.
This flag cannot be used with open operations, such as StgOpenStorageEx or IStorage::OpenStream.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_CONVERT
member.summary: Creates the new object while preserving existing data in a stream named "Contents". In the case of a storage object or a byte array, the old data is formatted into a stream regardless of whether the existing file or byte array currently contains a layered storage object. This flag can only be used when creating a root storage object. It cannot be used within a storage object; for example, in IStorage::CreateStream. It is also not valid to use this flag and the STGM_DELETEONRELEASE flag simultaneously.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_FAILIFTHERE
member.summary: Causes the create operation to fail if an existing object with the specified name exists. In this case, STG_E_FILEALREADYEXISTS is returned. This is the default creation mode; that is, if no other create flag is specified, STGM_FAILIFTHERE is implied.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_DIRECT
member.summary: Indicates that, in direct mode, each change to a storage or stream element is written as it occurs. This is the default if neither STGM_DIRECT nor STGM_TRANSACTED is specified.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_TRANSACTED
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, changes are buffered and written only if an explicit commit operation is called. To ignore the changes, call the Revert method in the IStream, IStorage, or IPropertyStorage interface. The COM compound file implementation of IStorage does not support transacted streams, which means that streams can be opened only in direct mode, and you cannot revert changes to them, however transacted storages are supported. The compound file, stand-alone, and NTFS file system implementations of IPropertySetStorage similarly do not support transacted, simple property sets because these property sets are stored in streams. However, transactioning of nonsimple property sets, which can be created by specifying the PROPSETFLAG_NONSIMPLE flag in the grfFlags parameter of IPropertySetStorage::Create, are supported.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_NOSCRATCH
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, a temporary scratch file is usually used to save modifications until the Commit method is called. Specifying STGM_NOSCRATCH permits the unused portion of the original file to be used as work space instead of creating a new file for that purpose. This does not affect the data in the original file, and in certain cases can result in improved performance. It is not valid to specify this flag without also specifying STGM_TRANSACTED, and this flag may only be used in a root open. For more information about NoScratch mode, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_NOSNAPSHOT
member.summary: This flag is used when opening a storage object with STGM_TRANSACTED and without STGM_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE or STGM_SHARE_DENY_WRITE. In this case, specifying STGM_NOSNAPSHOT prevents the system-provided implementation from creating a snapshot copy of the file. Instead, changes to the file are written to the end of the file. Unused space is not reclaimed unless consolidation is performed during the commit, and there is only one current writer on the file. When the file is opened in no snapshot mode, another open operation cannot be performed without specifying STGM_NOSNAPSHOT. This flag may only be used in a root open operation. For more information about NoSnapshot mode, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_SIMPLE
member.summary: Provides a faster implementation of a compound file in a limited, but frequently used, case. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_DIRECT_SWMR
member.summary: Supports direct mode for single-writer, multireader file operations. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.STGM_ACCESS.STGM_DELETEONRELEASE
member.summary: Indicates that the underlying file is to be automatically destroyed when the root storage object is released. This feature is most useful for creating temporary files. This flag can only be used when creating a root object, such as with StgCreateStorageEx. It is not valid when opening a root object, such as with StgOpenStorageEx, or when creating or opening a subelement, such as with IStorage::CreateStream. It is also not valid to use this flag and the STGM_CONVERT flag simultaneously.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.WTS_ALPHATYPE

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.WTS_ALPHATYPE.WTSAT_RGB

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.WTS_ALPHATYPE.WTSAT_ARGB
