member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVGIO.SVGIO_ALLVIEW
member.summary: Used in the same way as SVGIO.Selection but refers to all items in the view.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVGIO.SVGIO_CHECKED
member.summary: Used in the same way as SVGIO.Selection but refers to checked items in views where checked mode is supported. For more details on checked mode, see FOLDERFLAGS.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVGIO.SVGIO_TYPEMASK
member.summary: Masks all bits but those corresponding to the SVGIO flags.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVGIO.SVGIO_FLAG_VIEWORDER
member.summary: Returns the items in the order they appear in the view. If this flag is not set, the selected item will be listed first.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI
member.summary: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb762593(VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_DESELECT
member.summary: Deselect the item.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_SELECT
member.summary: Select the item.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_EDIT
member.summary: Put the name of the item into rename mode.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_DESELECTOTHERS
member.summary: Deselect all but the selected item. If the item parameter is NULL, deselect all items.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_ENSUREVISIBLE
member.summary: In the case of a folder that cannot display all of its contents on one screen, display the portion that contains the selected item.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_FOCUSED
member.summary: Give the selected item the focus when multiple items are selected, placing the item first in any list of the collection returned by a method.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_TRANSLATEPT
member.summary: Convert the input point from screen coordinates to the list-view client coordinates.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_SELECTIONMARK
member.summary: Mark the item so that it can be queried using IFolderView::GetSelectionMarkedItem.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_POSITIONITEM
member.summary: Allows the window's default view to position the item. In most cases, this will place the item in the first available position. However, if the call comes during the processing of a mouse-positioned context menu, the position of the context menu is used to position the item.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_CHECK
member.summary: The item should be checked. This flag is used with items in views where the checked mode is supported.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_CHECK2
member.summary: The second check state when the view is in tri-check mode, in which there are three values for the checked state. You can indicate tri-check mode by specifying FWF_TRICHECKSELECT in IFolderView2::SetCurrentFolderFlags. The 3 states for FWF_TRICHECKSELECT are unchecked, SVSI_CHECK and SVSI_CHECK2.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_KEYBOARDSELECT
member.summary: Selects the item and marks it as selected by the keyboard. Includes the flag.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_NOTAKEFOCUS
member.summary: An operation to select or focus an item should not also set focus on the view itself.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SVSI.SVSI_NOSTATECHANGE
member.summary: An operation to edit or position an item should not affect the item's focus or selected state.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags
member.summary: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms633545(VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.None
member.summary: The property is shown by default.

member.summary: The property is centered.

member.summary: The property is right aligned.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.BeginNewGroup
member.summary: The property is shown as the beginning of the next collection of properties in the view.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.FillArea
member.summary: The remainder of the view area is filled with the content of this property.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.SortDescending
member.summary: The property is reverse sorted if it is a property in a list of sorted properties.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.ShowOnlyIfPresent
member.summary: The property is only shown if it is present.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.ShowByDefault
member.summary: The property is shown by default in a view (where applicable).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.ShowInPrimaryList
member.summary: The property is shown by default in primary column selection user interface (UI).

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.ShowInSecondaryList
member.summary: The property is shown by default in secondary column selection UI.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.HideLabel
member.summary: The label is hidden if the view is normally inclined to show the label.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.Hidden
member.summary: The property is not displayed as a column in the UI.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.CanWrap
member.summary: The property is wrapped to the next row.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyViewOptions.MaskAll
member.summary: A mask used to retrieve all flags.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions
member.summary: Describes the attributes of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.None
member.summary: The property uses the default values for all attributes.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.MultipleValues
member.summary: The property can have multiple values.
member.remarks: These values are stored as a VT_VECTOR in the PROPVARIANT structure. This value is set by the multipleValues attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.IsInnate
member.summary: This property cannot be written to.
member.remarks: This value is set by the isInnate attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.IsGroup
member.summary: The property is a group heading.
member.remarks: This value is set by the isGroup attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.CanGroupBy
member.summary: The user can group by this property.
member.remarks: This value is set by the canGroupBy attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.CanStackBy
member.summary: The user can stack by this property.
member.remarks: This value is set by the canStackBy attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.IsTreeProperty
member.summary: This property contains a hierarchy.
member.remarks: This value is set by the isTreeProperty attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.IncludeInFullTextQuery
member.summary: Include this property in any full text query that is performed.
member.remarks: This value is set by the includeInFullTextQuery attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.IsViewable
member.summary: This property is meant to be viewed by the user.
member.remarks: This influences whether the property shows up in the "Choose Columns" dialog, for example. This value is set by the isViewable attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.IsQueryable
member.summary: This property is included in the list of properties that can be queried.
member.remarks: A queryable property must also be viewable. This influences whether the property shows up in the query builder UI. This value is set by the isQueryable attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.CanBePurged
member.summary: Used with an innate property (that is, a value calculated from other property values) to indicate that it can be deleted.
member.remarks: Windows Vista with Service Pack 1 (SP1) and later. This value is used by the Remove Properties user interface (UI) to determine whether to display a check box next to an property that allows that property to be selected for removal. Note that a property that is not innate can always be purged regardless of the presence or absence of this flag.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.IsSystemProperty
member.summary: This property is owned by the system.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyTypeOptions.MaskAll
member.summary: A mask used to retrieve all flags.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertySortDescription
member.summary: Describes the particular wordings of sort offerings.
member.remarks: Note that the strings shown are English versions only; localized strings are used for other locales.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertySortDescription.General
member.summary: The default ascending or descending property sort, "Sort going up", "Sort going down".

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertySortDescription.AToZ
member.summary: The alphabetical sort, "A on top", "Z on top".

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertySortDescription.LowestToHighest
member.summary: The numerical sort, "Lowest on top", "Highest on top".

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertySortDescription.SmallestToBiggest
member.summary: The size sort, "Smallest on top", "Largest on top".

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertySortDescription.OldestToNewest
member.summary: The chronological sort, "Oldest on top", "Newest on top".

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyAggregationType
member.summary: Property Aggregation Type

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyAggregationType.Default
member.summary: The string "Multiple Values" is displayed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyAggregationType.First
member.summary: The first value in the selection is displayed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyAggregationType.Sum
member.summary: The sum of the selected values is displayed. This flag is never returned for data types VT_LPWSTR, VT_BOOL, and VT_FILETIME.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyAggregationType.Average
member.summary: The numerical average of the selected values is displayed. This flag is never returned for data types VT_LPWSTR, VT_BOOL, and VT_FILETIME.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyAggregationType.DateRange
member.summary: The date range of the selected values is displayed. This flag is only returned for values of the VT_FILETIME data type.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyAggregationType.Union
member.summary: A concatenated string of all the values is displayed. The order of individual values in the string is undefined. The concatenated string omits duplicate values; if a value occurs more than once, it only appears a single time in the concatenated string.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyAggregationType.Max
member.summary: The highest of the selected values is displayed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyAggregationType.Min
member.summary: The lowest of the selected values is displayed.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used with IConditionFactory, ICondition, and IConditionGenerator to indicate the operation.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.Implicit
member.summary: The implicit comparison between the value of the property and the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.Equal
member.summary: The value of the property and the value of the constant must be equal.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.NotEqual
member.summary: The value of the property and the value of the constant must not be equal.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.LessThan
member.summary: The value of the property must be less than the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.GreaterThan
member.summary: The value of the property must be greater than the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.LessThanOrEqual
member.summary: The value of the property must be less than or equal to the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.GreaterThanOrEqual
member.summary: The value of the property must be greater than or equal to the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.ValueStartsWith
member.summary: The value of the property must begin with the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.ValueEndsWith
member.summary: The value of the property must end with the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.ValueContains
member.summary: The value of the property must contain the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.ValueNotContains
member.summary: The value of the property must not contain the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.DOSWildCards
member.summary: The value of the property must match the value of the constant, where '?' matches any single character and '*' matches any sequence of characters.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.WordEqual
member.summary: The value of the property must contain a word that is the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.WordStartsWith
member.summary: The value of the property must contain a word that begins with the value of the constant.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyConditionOperation.ApplicationSpecific
member.summary: The application is free to interpret this in any suitable way.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions
member.summary: Delineates the format of a property string.
member.remarks: Typically use one, or a bitwise combination of these flags, to specify the format. Some flags are mutually exclusive, so combinations like ShortTime | LongTime | HideTime are not allowed.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.None
member.summary: The format settings specified in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.PrefixName
member.summary: The value preceded with the property's display name.
member.remarks: This flag is ignored when the hideLabelPrefix attribute of the labelInfo element in the property's .propinfo file is set to true.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.FileName
member.summary: The string treated as a file name.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.AlwaysKB
member.summary: The sizes displayed in kilobytes (KB), regardless of size.
member.remarks: This flag applies to properties of Integer types and aligns the values in the column.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.RightToLeft
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.ShortTime
member.summary: The time displayed as 'hh:mm am/pm'.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.LongTime
member.summary: The time displayed as 'hh:mm:ss am/pm'.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.HideTime
member.summary: The time portion of date/time hidden.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.ShortDate
member.summary: The date displayed as 'MM/DD/YY'. For example, '3/21/04'.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.LongDate
member.summary: The date displayed as 'DayOfWeek Month day, year'. For example, 'Monday, March 21, 2004'.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.HideDate
member.summary: The date portion of date/time hidden.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.RelativeDate
member.summary: The friendly date descriptions, such as "Yesterday".

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.UseEditInvitation
member.summary: The text displayed in a text box as a cue for the user, such as 'Enter your name'.
member.remarks: The invitation text is returned if formatting failed or the value was empty. Invitation text is text displayed in a text box as a cue for the user, Formatting can fail if the data entered is not of an expected type, such as putting alpha characters in a phone number field.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.ReadOnly
member.summary: This flag requires UseEditInvitation to also be specified. When the formatting flags are ReadOnly | UseEditInvitation and the algorithm would have shown invitation text, a string is returned that indicates the value is "Unknown" instead of the invitation text.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.NoAutoReadingOrder
member.summary: The detection of the reading order is not automatic. Useful when converting to ANSI to omit the Unicode reading order characters.

member.name: F:Jam.Shell.Com.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.SmartDateTime
member.summary: Smart display of DateTime values

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.ShellBrowser.ResetFPU
member.summary: Resets the floating point control register to what .NET expects.
member.remarks: When ShellBrowser calls Api functions that involve third party ShellExtensions it can happen that the FPU register is changed. As a consequence following .NET framework calls may fail (e.g. ArithmeticExceptions). Calling this method resets the original state of the FPU register.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.ShellBrowser.DesignTimeUsageDenied(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This is the Access denial check on designtime. It always returns "false" if the Software was compiled with the #define JAMSHAREWARE. In case of a Full-Version it checks whether a Development-License is present, if in DesignMode and m_DesignTimeUsageChecked is false. It does so by calling the first time and then stores its return value in m_DesignTimeUsageDenied.
member.param: this is the DesignMode property of e.g. or .

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.LicenseChecking.VerifyDevelopmentLicense
member.summary: Verifies the availability of a development license for the components. The method first tries to open the registry key to the application path in HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, if it is not found it looks in HKEY_CURRENT_USER and searches for the development license in the sub directory \bin if both keys do not exist it tries to locate the license assembly in the path this assembly has been loaded from.
member.returns: true if the development license is valid

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.ShellListView
member.summary:
This control displays the contents of a folder in a listview. When the user right clicks on a folder, it will automatically show the context menu. Use to property to get or set the current folder, use the property to set a special folder like the Control Panel. The property can be used to filter certain files by extension. The method refreshes the displayed information. You can synchronize a ShellListView with a by using the property. By default, a double click is handled by the control and it tries to perform the default action for the selected object.
Items that are contained in the list are of type . This applies to the and the properties.
Sorting is handled automatically by this list when column headers are clicked. If custom sorting is needed, an can be assigned to property . See for an example.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.ShellListView.SmartRefresh
member.summary: Use the SmartRefresh to update the contents of a . In comparison to the method, SmartRefresh is much faster, but only removes objects which have been deleted and adds objects which have been added. It does not update changed file sizes or dates. Usually this method will be called automatically, when a file was added or deleted.

member.returns: Returns a value less than 0 if x is less than y, 0 if x is equal to y and a value greater than 0 if x is greater than y.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ShellListView.UseThreadPool
member.summary: Whether to use the system threadpool to obtain information on listview items. If this property is false, the complete file detail information is retrieved as soon as the item is displayed the first time within the listview. If the property is true thumbnails and icons are fetched in worker threads in the background. The setting of this property affects the control the next time the method is called.

member.name: M:Jam.Shell.BasicWorkItem.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allowing to abort is disabled per default since thread aborting results in unstable system state, see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/magazine/cc163644.aspx : [..] "I'll caution you against using Thread.Abort to control the lifetime of a thread, especially if you have little knowledge about the implementation of the code you're aborting. An abort inside of a critical region could spell disaster for an entire AppDomain, and while a polite abort does signficantly reduce the window of disaster to very tiny slivers, that one time out of 1,000 could lead to a deadlock or resource leak or worse."
member.param: If true, the thread is aborted via if the is exceeded.

member.name: T:Jam.Shell.ThumbnailImage
member.summary: Use this component to display a thumbnail image of a file or folder. The same thumbnail image that the Windows Explorer uses will be shown. The Windows Shell does not supply a thumbnail image for all objects. You may either set the Path property to set a path to a file or folder for which the thumbnail image should be displayed. Or you may synchronize it to a or component using the property.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ThumbnailImage.Version

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ThumbnailImage.Path
member.summary: The Path property contains the full path of the file or folder which thumbnail image is currently displayed. Assign a value to this property to display a different thumbnail image.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ThumbnailImage.ShowErrorMessages
member.summary: If set to true the ThumbnailImage component will show a MessageBox if an error occured, otherwise the errors will only be logged to the Debug output.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ThumbnailImage.Enabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the control is enabled.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ThumbnailImage.Image
member.summary: Readonly property, which contains the currently shown thumbnail image.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ThumbnailImage.ShellControlConnector
member.summary: Use this property to connect this component to a ShellControlConnector. All shell controls connected to the same ShellControlConnector will automatically synchronize the information they display. That means if a user selects a file in a ShellListView, the ThumbnailImage will automatically display the thumbnail image of the selected object.

member.name: P:Jam.Shell.ThumbnailImage.IconsAsThumnbnails
member.summary: If set to true (default) the component uses icons if the shown file system element does not supply a thumbnail. Set false if only thumbnails are to be used.

member.name: E:Jam.Shell.ThumbnailImage.ThumbnailLoaded
member.summary: Event is thrown when the control has finished loading the image.

member.summary: Returns the width that is used for the image.

members.member: Returns the height that is used for the image.
